data.text: What Is Your Favorite Titanium Bicycle Brand?

What are your favorite Ti bike brands? For those that have owned or own a Titanium setup. Within a year, I plan on investing in my dream build, which is basically this geometry. Just still deciding on what brands to narrow it down to. I‚Äôve looked in to Ribble, Lynskey, Litespeed, Moots- (out of the question, one of the most expensive titanium brands out there). Thanks!

data.text: I dont understand why titanium frames are so expensive. I can buy imported titanium kickbikes for around $1200 from Europe that have as much titanium as is in mountain bike frames and forks. And those bikes arent even mass produced; they are made in some welder's garage. 15-20 lb bikes. You are definately getting ripped of when buying titanium mountain bikes. It is ridiculous.

data.text: I'm currently waiting for a Ribble CGR Ti Enthusiast (on order since October 2021). It will be the most expensive bike I've ever owned but will last me for life. Titanium seems like a great material for frames - strong, light and non-corrosive. No paint to get scratched, no helicopter tape needed when using bikepacking bags. Mine will be a winter road bike (full mudguard attachment points and bigger tyres safer on rubbish UK roads), a lightweight summer tourer (rack attachment points) and for mild off-road riding. Can't wait.
data.author: Jon Mathias

data.text: My reasoning for wanting a Ti frame. As lame as it sounds, I get anxiety seeing my frame get nicked and scratched, so titanium is a great material for not worrying about that. It just looks slick, and a good frame can last for life!

data.author: Dan Reilly

data.text: Still searching. Here‚Äôs the issue, there aren‚Äôt many that are not made in Asia and don‚Äôt cost 5 grands for the frame only when made in the US, I‚Äôm hoping my next will be made in the US. There aren‚Äôt many that are suspension corrected to allow a front suspension, which is a requirement of mine and nobody makes post-mount hydraulic brakes for drop bars anymore, which is required on a front suspension. Except for SRAM Force, but then you have to go AXS if you want 12 speed. I feel the industry has gone backwards, perhaps by design to sell electronic shifting. My v1 Salsa Cutthroat is equipped with a front suspension, post-mount hydraulic brakes and 1x 12-speed Shimano XT 10-51, good luck building such a rig today. To make matter worse, neither Shimano nor SRAM yet understand the need to have mountain bike range on drop bar mountain bikes, Shimano GRX is still not 12 speed while they have the technology for years and SRAM has yet to come up with a drop bar mountain bike/ gravel group that doesn‚Äôt require batteries.
data.author: Guillaume Dougados

data.text: I put sram 12 speed on my bearclaw thunderhawk, I put the xx1 10-52 cassette on it with an absolute black oval in front‚Ä¶it‚Äôs been awesome! Clears 50mm tires, too. I did go with AXS, but it‚Äôs amazing and I‚Äôm happy to have it, and definitely don‚Äôt see it as a negative.
data.author: Laura Wiesmann Hrubes

data.text: Yes that is one of the solutions. However, that is also one that requires taking a second mortgage, and, the system only provides 20 hours of ride time (per SRAM) on a full charge, which for multi-day bikepacking is less than ideal, it's a no-no for me. Currently, the only affordable option to go 12-speed and hydraulic on a drop-bar, is the Gevenalle shifter on TRP Hylex brakes, but TRP discontinued the post-mount brakes, so for bikes that need post-mount, it requires ASSolutions adapters, which do not work with all front suspensions, works fine on rigid. The next best option is hacking a SRAM 11-speed brifter with a Ratio-Tech 12-speed upgrade kit. SRAM cable-actuated road brifters are compatible with their mountain bike derailleurs. The system allows for example to use Force 1 levers which do have a post-mount hydraulic option, and a GX, X0 or XX 12-speed RD and cassette.
data.author: Guillaume Dougados

data.text: you can put post mount brakes on shimano systems. Buy a br-rs785 and have that installed in place of your flat mounts. You‚Äôll have no issue selling the flat mount calibers right now

Jon Sullivan

data.text: I am very happy with my fully custom-made Waltly (a Chinese custom shop), if you are comfortable designing your own frame with all you ever wanted it is a fantastic option and super price competitive option. There are people that will help you through the process (including me) for a fee or that do it for you and brand it under their name (some named above). If you end up with a fully custom Ti frame in the $1000 to $2000 range with all the options you ever thoughts about it is usually from one of the few custom Chinese shops which are now quite good. The only risk is that you fully control the design so if you ask for something stupid, like water bottle bosses under the down tube where the bottle will hit the front wheel, they will build something stupid just as you requested... As an illustration, I build a fixed un-adjustable integrated seat post just to make sure the bike would only fit me!!!ü§£

data.text: For me, Moots. I've been using Moots for the past ~15y. I've also had Merlin, Seven, Serotta, Litespeed. But I like Moots best. Recently, I was reading about Ti frames, and apparently Moots is one of the few brands that order high enough tubing quantities to be able to have a guarantee of highest quality. Smaller manufacturers have a more random selection of tube quality. This said, it is very possible that the lowest quality of tube on a Strong is plenty good, I have no idea. But I have never heard of a Moots failing/cracking (I'm sure this happens, just never heard of one). I got a full-custom Routt45 a few years ago, it is amazing. And I am thinking of ordering another full custom, the new Vamoots RCS.

data.text: I ordered two set of tires with mine 700x44 & 650x2.2‚Äù. Here is the gearing that I chose for each set. Pinion Gears For the 27.5 x 2.2 tires Teeth = 32x30 Gear Inches = 16.4 low to 98.7 high For the 29 x 44 tires (44-622) Teeth = 32 x 26 Gear inches = 19.3 low to 116 high
